Article.ArticleTitle: Predicting the rate constants of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) with ozone reaction at different temperatures.

AbstractText: Based on the bond order, fukui indices and other related descriptors, as well as temperature, a new QSAR model was established to predict the rate constant (k<sub>O3</sub>) of VOCs degradation by O<sub>3</sub>. 302 logk<sub>O3</sub> values (178-409 K) of 149 VOCs were divided into training set (242 logk<sub>O3</sub>) and test set (60 logk<sub>O3</sub>), respectively, which were used to construct and verify the QSAR model. The optimal model (R<sup>2</sup> = 0.83, q<sup>2</sup> = 0.82, Q<sub>ext</sub><sup>2</sup> = 0.72) shows that E<sub>HOMO</sub>, BO<sub>x</sub> and q(C<sup>-</sup>)<sub>n</sub> have a greater influence on the value of logk<sub>O3</sub>. In addition, fukui indices and logk<sub>O3</sub> are well correlated. The applicability domains of the current models can be used to predict k<sub>O3</sub> of a wide range of VOCs at different temperatures.
